sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As mass rallies are held across the world in honor of Alexei Navalny, dozens are arrested across Russia for holding memorials for the Kremlin critic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The death of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny has prompted mass gatherings and makeshift memorials across Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, unidentified individuals could be seen taking away flowers left to honor the prominent member of the Russian opposition, with the police watching on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to a local human rights group, around 100 people were detained in various Russian cities at morning rallies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian authorities have warned in advance against mass gatherings and protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Despite that, flowers, photos and candles were seen in many places across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, rallies in support of Navalny were held around the world through Friday and Saturday, with people gathering in front of Russian embassies and consulates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Buenos Aires, hundreds of Russian nationals demonstrated in front of the embassy gates, with one man ending up detained for attempting to throw eggs at the building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rafah officials say two overnight Israeli airstrikes on the area have killed at least 13 people, including nine members of the same family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The number of Palestinians killed during Israel's war on Gaza has surpassed 28,000 people, according to the Hamas-run health ministry. The strikes come as Israel plans to execute an assault on the enclave's southernmost city, where 1.4 million Palestinian men, women and children are sheltering. The decision drew international condemnation, especially from neighboring Egypt, which openly fears an uncontrolled flow of refugees into its territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, Egyptian authorities are organizing more fundraisers to help the Palestinians in the Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, the Ministry of Solidarity launched a charity marathon called Run for Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Around 10,000 athletes from 30 countries are expected to participate with the proceedings to purchase more aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of people rallied in Budapest on Friday in support of victims of child abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The protest comes following the resignation of now former Hungarian president Katalin Novak after it was revealed she pardoned an accomplice of a child sexual abuser.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is the greatest sin to associate with anyone who has assisted her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Speakers tried to avoid partisan politics, focusing instead on the children's cause.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is good that this protest is not so much about one party, but rather a mass movement." The pardon has shocked Hungarian society and opened fissures within Orb√°n's Fidesz party, which has governed the country with a constitutional majority for nearly 14 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In an unsuccessful attempt to quell public anger, the government proposed a constitutional amendment that would bar pardons to those convicted of crimes against minors Donald Trump's legal woes

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: are far from over on Friday a New York judge ruled he must pay almost three hundred and fifty five million dollars in penalties due to fraudulently overstating his net worth to trick banks and insurers the judge also served him with a three-year ban from serving as an officer or director of any New York corporation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Trump's lawyers vowed to appeal the decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Friday's ruling comes as the former president is running for presidency this year and faces four criminal cases against him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Bill Bowers' Guggenheim Museum in Spain is soon to feature some pop art.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The exhibition Signs and Objects Pop Art from the Guggenheim Collection features works from the holdings of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The exhibition showcases the development of the pop art movement, which emerged in the late 1950s in England and later in 1960 in the United States. Pop art is really characterized by its use of mass media and visual imagery from popular culture, so drawing on billboards, advertisements and newspapers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Pop art's heyday lasted until around the 80s. At the time, society was mainly characterized by consumerism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The exhibit is showing at Bilbao's Guggenheim Museum until the 15th of September.
